185355610.review: Star Trek: Timelines is Q-Driven gonzo gatcha strategy fun. 76 hours in and i haven't spent anything, so ftp is definitely an option.

185243958.review:
I really like this game. I really really like this game. This game is similar to Cookie Run: Kingdom for anyone who's familiar with it. (except this game doesn't crash every 10 minutes like cookie run does)

In this game, you're the captain. Q shows up like- "Captain! I need your help! Time's all weird again and different timelines are collapsing in on each other and no one knows what's going on except for me but I won't help you" or something like that and now you're PR for the new galaxy.

There is a gatcha system and microtransactions if you're wary of those. 

HERE'S THE FUN PART:
You answer distress calls and put together an away team like in TNG. You choose 3 members of your crew based on their skills and traits. There are also choices that affect the overall story (like who to direct your support to in episode 1 of the story; the klingons or the augments). The away team levels play out like an episode of TNG.

And the characters you obtain aren't limited to one show or movie. For example, I have both Captain Picard and Captain Sisko.

I have not spent a dime on this game, and I enjoy it a great deal. I would recommend this game to anyone who likes Star Trek.

183822094.review: most of my 26 hours is trying to close the CONSTANT store pop ups while figuring out what the 100 buttons and menus do
